text:
65th Street, west side, at 62nd Ave. (center of view), showing in the foreground at the S.W. corner, the former Mount Olivet Hotel. This hotel which was owned in 1891 by Welz and Zerweck was operated by Louis Niederstein Jr. Beyond it is the Fresh Pond Crematory.

January 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Queens: Mt Olivet Crescent - 62nd Avenue

text:
Mt. Olivet Crescent, north from Sixty-second Ave., showing the Fresh Pond Crematory located on the N.W. corner of the aforementioned streets.  The Lutheran Cemetery is directly Opposite.  In 1884, thirteen city lots were purchased by the Fresh Pond Crematory at Mount Olivet.  The cornerstone of the original frame building was laid November 19, 1884, and on December 4, 1885, this building was used for the first time.  The present buildings were erected in 1892.

January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Queens: Mount Olivet Crescent - 62nd Avenue
